includeLayers.name: Indeks Bahaya Gelombang Ekstrim dan Abrasi
includeLayers.displayName: Extreme Wave and Abrasion Hazard Risk
includeLayers.description: Physical exposure to extreme wave and abrasion. InaSAFE has been jointly developed by the Indonesian Government-BNPB, the Australian Government, the World Bank-GFDRR and independent contributors. 2015

includeLayers.name: Indeks Bahaya Cuaca Eksttrim
includeLayers.description: Physical exposure to extreme weather. InaSAFE has been jointly developed by the Indonesian Government-BNPB, the Australian Government, the World Bank-GFDRR and independent contributors. 2015

includeLayers.name: Indeks Bahaya Banjir
includeLayers.description: Physical exposure to flood hazard. A flood describes the inundation of land that is normally dry by a large amount of water. For example, a flood can occur after heavy rainfall, when a river overflows its banks. The effect of a flood is for land that is normally dry to become wet.InaSAFE has been jointly developed by the Indonesian Government-BNPB, the Australian Government, the World Bank-GFDRR and independent contributors. 2015

includeLayers.name: Indeks Kerentanan Gelombang Ekstrim dan Abrasi
includeLayers.description: Vulnerability is defined as physical (women, elderly, disabled), socio-cultural, economy, and environment that is vulnerable to extreme wave and abrasion. InaSAFE has been jointly developed by the Indonesian Government-BNPB, the Australian Government, the World Bank-GFDRR and independent contributors. 2015

includeLayers.name: Indeks Kerentanan Cuaca Ekstrim
includeLayers.description: Vulnerability is defined as physical (women, elderly, disabled), socio-cultural, economy, and environment that is vulnerable to extreme weather. InaSAFE has been jointly developed by the Indonesian Government-BNPB, the Australian Government, the World Bank-GFDRR and independent contributors. 2015

includeLayers.name: Indeks Kerentanan Banjir
includeLayers.description: Vulnerability is defined as physical (women, elderly, disabled), socio-cultural, economy, and environment that is vulnerable to flooding. A flood describes the inundation of land that is normally dry by a large amount of water. For example, a flood can occur after heavy rainfall, when a river overflows its banks. The effect of a flood is for land that is normally dry to become wet.InaSAFE has been jointly developed by the Indonesian Government-BNPB, the Australian Government, the World Bank-GFDRR and independent contributors. 2015

includeLayers.name: Indeks Risiko Gelombang Ekstrim dan Abrasi
includeLayers.description: Combined physical exposure, vulnerability, and capacity scores relating to extreme wave and abrasion hazard. Capacity includes institutional factors, resilience, and mitigation or prevention capacity. InaSAFE has been jointly developed by the Indonesian Government-BNPB, the Australian Government, the World Bank-GFDRR and independent contributors. 2015

includeLayers.name: Indeks Risiko Cuaca Ekstrim
includeLayers.description: Combined physical exposure, vulnerability, and capacity scores relating to extreme weather hazard. Capacity includes institutional factors, resilience, and mitigation or prevention capacity. InaSAFE has been jointly developed by the Indonesian Government-BNPB, the Australian Government, the World Bank-GFDRR and independent contributors. 2015

includeLayers.name: Indeks Risiko Banjir
includeLayers.description: Combined physical exposure, vulnerability, and capacity scores relating to flood hazard. Capacity includes institutional factors, resilience, and mitigation or prevention capacity. A flood describes the inundation of land that is normally dry by a large amount of water. For example, a flood can occur after heavy rainfall, when a river overflows its banks. The effect of a flood is for land that is normally dry to become wet.InaSAFE has been jointly developed by the Indonesian Government-BNPB, the Australian Government, the World Bank-GFDRR and independent contributors. 2015
